name: The Ten Most Famous Literary Characters Multiple Choice Quiz | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.text: Hamlet. Often considered to be the greatest play by the greatest writer, the title character is instantly recognizable to everyone. What caused the death of Hamlet's father?
questions.explanation:
Poison.

	In my opinion, Romeo and Juliet would be next in line as Shakespeare's most well-known characters.

questions.text: Sherlock Holmes. The name instantly brings to mind images of deductive powers, snappy clothing and a dull sidekick. Which of the following is a Holmes story?
questions.explanation:
'A Study in Scarlet'.

	The most famous detective in fiction.

questions.text: Poe's Raven. Quite possibly the most famous character in American poetry. In what month did the narrator of the poem encounter the raven?
questions.explanation:
December.

	'Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak December ...'. The most famous American poem.

questions.text: Oedipus. Thanks to Freud, this character from Greek drama is known to all. Author of "Oedipus Rex"?
questions.explanation:
Sophocles.

	A name immortalized forever in psychoanalytic theory.

questions.text: Scrooge. Dickens' character easily summons forth images of dour miserliness. Who was his partner?
questions.explanation:
Jacob Marley.

	Oliver Twist and David Copperfield might also be considered.

questions.text: Frankenstein. The very word immediately makes one think of the word 'monster'. Author?
Moby Dick. Back to American literature - this time a novel -the White Whale calls forth images of pursuit and obsession. Who was the captain in pursuit?
questions.explanation:
Ahab.

	A favorite of English teachers, anyway.

questions.text: Scarlett O'Hara. The main figure in one of the most popular novels of all time. Which of the following is NOT a CHARACTER in the novel?
questions.explanation:
Tara.

	Not a bad movie, either.

questions.text: Charlie Brown. A comic strip may not be literature, but the huge popularity of 'Peanuts' (and of poor, struggling Charlie Brown) is known to countless millions. What is his father's occupation?
Tarzan. The name instantly calls to mind wild, untamed, primitive man. Author?
questions.explanation:
Edgar Rice Burroughs.

	Perpetuated by the movies.
